title: Juan Orlando Hernández, Former President of Honduras, Is Freed From Prison After Trump Pardon
summary: Juan Orlando Hernández was accused of flooding the United States with cocaine and had been sentenced to 45 years in prison.

title: The Ex-President Whom Trump Plans to Pardon Flooded America With Cocaine
summary: Juan Orlando Hernández, whom Mr. Trump called a victim of persecution, helped orchestrate a decades-long trafficking conspiracy. It ravaged his Central American country.

title: Kristi Noem Recommends New Travel Ban After National Guard Shooting
summary: Kristi Noem, the secretary of homeland security, equated immigrants to “foreign invaders” as she called for an expanded travel ban. President Trump reposted her statement.

title: Maduro Faces His Ultimate Fight as Trump Threatens Military Action in Venezuela
summary: President Trump’s threat of military action has confronted President Nicolás Maduro of Venezuela with the gravest challenge of his crisis-ridden reign.

title: Venezuela Accepts Migrant Repatriation Flight From U.S. Amid Airspace Tensions
summary: The flight’s approval illustrates how the United States and Venezuela are still communicating, after a declaration from President Trump that Venezuelan airspace was “closed in its entirety.”

title: Hegseth Ordered Lethal Boat Strike but Not the Killing of Survivors, Officials Say
summary: Amid talk of war crimes, the details and precise sequence of a Sept. 2 attack on a boat in the Caribbean are facing intensifying scrutiny.

title: Joe Kahn, New York Times Executive Editor, Answers Reader Questions
summary: We asked readers for their questions for The Times’s executive editor about how we cover the news and make judgment calls in our reporting and editing.

title: Putin and Witkoff Meet in Russia as U.S. Pushes Ukraine Deal
summary: In Moscow, Steve Witkoff, President Trump’s special envoy, and Jared Kushner, Mr. Trump’s son-in-law, were expected to discuss a revised peace proposal.

title: The 10 Best Books of 2025
summary: The staff of The New York Times Book Review choose the year’s top fiction and nonfiction.

title: Michael and Susan Dell Pledge $6 Billion in Investment ‘Trump Accounts’ for Children
summary: The tech billionaire and his wife hope other philanthropists follow their $6 billion lead in expanding the reach of soon-to-be-created “Trump accounts.”

title: What to Know About Trump Accounts for Children and Eligibility After Dell Donation
summary: Next year, Michael and Susan Dell plan to move $250 into the new Trump accounts of millions of children under 10. You’ll need to live in the right ZIP code.

title: What Michael Dell’s Blockbuster Donation Means for Philanthropy
summary: Michael Dell and his wife, Susan Dell, plan to give away billions of dollars to fund investment accounts for children in the United States.

title: Vaccine Committee May Make Significant Changes to Childhood Schedule
summary: Comments by President Trump, Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and some panelists suggest the committee is likely to delay hepatitis B shots and discuss revising the use of other vaccines.

title: The Dark Secrets of Denis Johnson’s ‘Train Dreams’
summary: An adaptation of Denis Johnson’s novella arrives at the same time as a new biography, unlocking one of his best-loved and least-understood books.

title: Four-Star Restaurant Review for Yamada
summary: The ever-changing menu at this unshowy restaurant in Chinatown exemplifies the subtle art of the most rarefied form of Japanese cooking.

title: What Makes a Four-Star Restaurant? Our Critics Break It Down.
summary: As Ligaya Mishan gives highest honors to a Japanese kaiseki counter in New York, she and Tejal Rao discuss what goes into the decision.

title: Tennessee House Special Election 2025: What to Watch
summary: A special election for a House seat in Tennessee was supposed to be an easy Republican victory. But national spending and Democratic enthusiasm have made it an unusually high-profile race.

title: Democrats in New Jersey Ram Through Bill to Defang a Corruption Watchdog
summary: A State Senate committee moved to weaken an office that investigates police misconduct and government waste. Senator Andy Kim spoke in opposition but was cut off after three minutes.

title: How Democrats Have Performed in 2025 Special Elections
summary: Tennessee’s Seventh District was created to be safely Republican, but in recent special elections across the country Democrats have done significantly better than they did in 2024.

title: Mandela Barnes Enters Wisconsin Governor Race, Joining Crowded Field of Democrats
summary: The former lieutenant governor is the best-known candidate in a crowded field, but some state Democrats have cooled on him since he lost a Senate bid in 2022.

title: How a Verdict by a Jury of 11 People in Queens Made Legal History
summary: New York’s highest court let a verdict by 11 jurors stand in a criminal case that involved an escort, machetes and a mysterious visitor. The ruling broke 342 years of precedent.

title: In Photos and Video: Devastating Floods Swamp South Asia
summary: Images of the destruction caused by storms that have torn through South and Southeast Asia.

title: Pregnancy After 35: The So-Called ‘Fertility Cliff,’ Explained
summary: The idea that the chances of getting pregnant plummet at 35 is widespread. But it’s not totally true.

title: Large Winter Storm Brings Snow and Ice to Northeast and Mid-Atlantic
summary: The major storm dropped a wintry mix of precipitation across the Midwest overnight, creating a treacherous commute for millions of Americans.

title: The Medical Case for Self-Driving Cars
summary: Compared to human drivers, Waymo cars were involved in 91 percent fewer crashes that resulted in serious injuries.

title: Ultra-Orthodox Jewish Couples on the Anxiety Around Their Wedding Night
summary: An ultra-Orthodox Jewish filmmaker asks members of her community about the silent anxieties surrounding intimacy on their wedding nights.

title: Who Gets a Presidential Pardon?
summary: We examine President Trump’s approach to using his pardon power.

title: San Francisco Will Sue Ultraprocessed Food Companies
summary: The city attorney accuses large manufacturers of causing diseases that have burdened governments with public health costs.

title: School Integration Has Lost Steam. Will Mamdani Revive It in New York?
summary: Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani has spoken about integrating America’s largest education system in striking terms rarely heard from big city leaders.

title: Thousands Greet Pope Leo as He Prays Near Site of Beirut Port Blast
summary: A waterfront Mass in the Lebanese capital capped the pope’s three-day visit to the Middle Eastern nation with the largest proportion of Christians.

title: Silicon Valley Builds Amazon and Gmail Copycats to Train A.I. Agents
summary: Several new start-ups are building replicas of sites so A.I. can learn to use the internet and maybe replace white-collar workers.
